title: 8 Essential Figma Tips Empower Designers to Build Scalable Branded Templates in Buzz

paragraphs.content: Figma's official guide outlines eight key tips for designers creating branded templates in Figma Buzz, focusing on responsive layouts and modular structures to enable marketing teams to produce on-brand assets efficiently. These tips emphasize using auto layout for consistent spacing, separating text layers for bulk creation from CSV or XLSX files, and employing component variants for customizable elements like logos and icons. Figma Buzz serves as a collaborative space where designers publish templates that marketers can edit without breaking brand consistency.

paragraphs.content: Designers can publish templates directly from Figma Design files by copying frames into Buzz, setting editable layers, and adding properties for layout, color, or size variations. Clear layer naming, such as "Event Title" or "CTA Button Text," with example text like "Date of Event (e.g. July 10, 2025)," enhances usability during editing. This approach supports Bulk Create for generating multiple assets at scale while maintaining flexibility.

sections.title: Leveraging Auto Layout and Text Separation for Responsive Templates

paragraphs.content: Auto layout forms the foundation of responsive templates by ensuring buttons, text boxes, and images maintain spacing even with varying content lengths, such as long headlines. Separating text layers for unique inputs prevents formatting issues during bulk asset generation, where data from spreadsheets maps directly to specific layers. Designers should rename layers descriptively and include formatting examples to guide non-designer users effectively.

paragraphs.content: Component variants allow customization of elements like horizontal or vertical logo lockups and multi-color illustrations via the Swap Content feature, reducing the need for multiple templates. Usability testing in Buzz's focused editing view checks for issues like text overlap or misaligned content when swapping images or resizing assets. Standardizing file titles and row groupings improves template discoverability for teams.

sections.title: Component Properties and Publishing Workflows in Figma Buzz

paragraphs.content: Boolean properties enable toggling elements like logos on or off across assets, exposing simple controls in Buzz for marketers. Variant properties handle size, layout, or color changes, while instance swaps facilitate quick exchanges of nested components such as icons. Publishing involves selecting frames in Figma Design, pasting into Buzz, and curating editable content to empower teams without design expertise.

paragraphs.content: Templates in Buzz integrate design system components for on-brand flexibility, allowing tweaks without context switching between tools. Teams start from templates or scratch, browsing and customizing for social media, ads, or one-pagers while locked elements preserve guidelines. This workflow accelerates asset production, making Buzz a superior alternative to tools like Canva for consistent branding.
